If This Was A Movie

by AgathaLovesRio

Summary

Agatha is THE Hollywood star, America's Sweetheart, and absolute Hollywood royalty. She is a single mom to 16-year-old Nicholas Harkness, a student at SHIELD High School.
Rio is the new, science teacher at the Hollywood elite school and holds a strict no dating parents policy.

When Agathaâ€™s famous chaotic reverie meets Rioâ€™s down-to-earth simplicity, the attraction should be undeniable. But, the winds of fate have more in store for these two and their coven of friends as they come to terms with their love and desire.

Notes

The first five chapters have been edited and this isn't short anymore...
Enjoy!

Tomorrow is Just A Mystery and That's Okay

Chapter Summary

Meet Rio Vidal and her best friend, Alice Wu-Gulliver.

Late July

â€œThere! Itâ€™s perfect!â€ Rio Vidal exclaimed as she placed the last plant on a bookshelf. Her new Los Angeles apartment was now completely unpacked and decorated. It felt like home.

She took a deep breath, inhaling the scent of the orchids and azaleas placed around the apartment. They werenâ€™t the easiest plants to grow in planters and keep inside, but she had learned from the best. The bamboo plant was tucked into the corner of the dining room, which she took meticulous care of, and the succulents, which she carefully trimmed. They were probably her most prized possessions, something she had control over in a life in which she felt she had such little control.

â€œYou and your plants. You put more care into them than your actual lesson plans.â€ Alice Wu-Gulliver said from her spot on the couch with a teasing smile and changed the music playing on the Bluetooth speaker to a girl in red song.

Rio returned the smile as she looked over at her childhood best friend and pseudo-sister, and sat on the plush, forest-green couch beside her.

â€œPlants need love and care, you know that. Lesson plans are automatic at this point and follow a pattern and set of rules. I can write them in my sleep by now, and so can you."

Rio had taught science for thirteen years and loved it. She took care when she planned her lessons. She just knew the material well, especially biology, botany, and chemistry. Her three major loves growing up in San Francisco were animals, plants, and blowing things up.

â€œNo phoning it in at SHIELD, Ri. Calderu knows everything, and we have to keep the parents happyâ€”or nannies, au pairs, whoever it is,â€ Alice said, leaning her head to the side. She began recounting the different families and broke down who did what roles in each.

Rio knew how high-stakes her new position at SHIELD was. The acronym stood for The School for Hollywood's Innovative Education and Leadership Development - a pretentious name for a place where Hollywoodâ€™s elite sent their children. Hardly anyone knew what it actually stood for anymore; it was simply SHIELD.

Rio had first met the principal, Lilia Calderu, the previous spring when she had interviewed for the position from Rioâ€™s hospital bed. She was an older, petite woman. Rio recalled how Alice had told her that Lilia had taught at SHIELD since she came to LA and had ingrained herself amongst the Hollywood elite, learning secrets and becoming someone they confided in. Now, she knew everything and was well-respected in the community. Her New York upbringing and Sicilian ancestry added to her persona, and when Rio first met her, she automatically understood.

Alice had taught in the history department at SHIELD since 2014 and helped Rio get an interview with Lilia once Rio told Alice she was leaving the school in San Francisco. The elite school in Los Angeles generally ran on a who-you-knew hiring system due to the unique demographics of the student body.

Rio chuckled. â€œRelax. I've got this, and youâ€™re the reason I have this job. Iâ€™m not going to make you look bad. Iâ€™ve taught the children of the rich and powerful before. My old school catered to the upper class, too. This wonâ€™t be too different from that, from the sounds of it. Signing non-disclosure agreements as a career requirement is a little odd, and having seen some of the parents naked in movies, or having crushes on them, might be awkward at first, but Iâ€™ll adjust.â€ Seeing Aliceâ€™s face scrunch at that, Rio got serious and held up her hand. â€œDonâ€™t worry. Alice smirked. â€œOh, itâ€™s not dating Iâ€™m worried about.â€ Alice lifted an eyebrow suggestively.

Rio laughed and smacked her with a decorative pillow that said â€œLive Laugh Lesbianâ€ on it, a housewarming gift from Alice one year. â€œI canâ€™t believe thatâ€™s allowed!â€ She said, still laughing. â€œItâ€™s one of the reasons we sign NDAs!â€ Alice exclaimed back, holding her arms up to block the pillow.

â€œSeriously, though, Alice, thank you so much for helping with everything. The job, finding the apartment, and being by my side. I am actually looking forward to professional development and in-service tomorrow for once, and not dreading it. Iâ€™m very curious to see who my students are, and more importantly, who their parents are.â€

Rio took a swig of her beer and reminisced on her previous years of teaching. Tomorrow would begin her fourteenth time preparing for a new school year, and it had long since lost its excitement. However, teaching in the same school as Alice for the first time in a decade and at this specific school was the beginning of a new adventure, and it reminded her of their first year of teaching.

Alice took a drink from her beer as well. â€œIâ€™m just glad youâ€™re finally here, and I can finally share everything with you again. The apartment was perfect timing since my neighbor moved out.â€

If the apartment next to Alice hadnâ€™t come available, then they had both planned on hunting for the perfect place with two units together, or a duplex. They hadnâ€™t been as close the past ten years due to distance and legalities. It had taken a toll on both of them, and it was time to put an end to that.

You've Got A Smile That Could Light Up This Whole Town

I Was Enchanted To Meet You

Chapter Summary

We learn some more backstory and our loveable idiots deny everything.
They'll do that for awhile.

Chapter Notes

I own nothing and will be using some tidbits that are canon.
Updated 5/6/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The playful conversation starts

Like passing notes in secrecy

This Night is Sparkling Don't You Let it Go

Chapter Summary

A party, flirty parents, and talking while the sunsets.
Just a normal Saturday.

Chapter Notes

DaretoDream82 and I feel like these chapters just feel so much better!
All the disclaimers.
Updated 5/6/2025

See the end of the chapter for more notes

This night is sparkling, don't you let it go

I'm wonderstruck, blushing all the way home

I'll spend forever wondering if you knew

That this night is flawless, don't you let it go

Enchanted - Taylor Swift

ğŸ¶

Early August

Rio was going to a party at Agatha Harknessâ€™s beach house.

Rioâ€™s school hadnâ€™t required NDAs, although she had a few semi-famous friends who personally required them.

Rio still told Alice everything, NDA or not.

Alice however, refused to break laws. She was far more of a stickler in that regard.

They were very different in that way, and Rio respected that, though she didnâ€™t like the secrets and lies. Rio didnâ€™t like lies and secrets due to her previous relationship, and Alice was very adverse to breaking contracts, laws, and unspoken agreements, due to her mother breaking the unspoken bond and agreement of motherhood.

Chapter Summary

Agatha takes Rio back to her house.

Chapter Notes

Chapter End Notes

Thank you for the comments and the kudos! You can find me on tumblr at deathbylesbianwitches, or twitter and bluesky at agathalovesrio.

Sometimes I forget what handles I use where. It's cool. This story is currently in the forefront of my mind and I'm trying to get it out as fast as it happens in my brain. AuDHD and all.

I Could Make The Bad Boys Good For The Weekend

Chapter Summary

Alice calls Jen, school begins, and everyone heads to the beach house for Labor Day weekend.
Lilia provides more cryptic messages and a bit of counsel, and we see a little more meddling.

Chapter Notes

Agatha and Jen are back to bickering, and Alice and Jen decide to pick up the pace.

I have no idea how Hollywood works, so...go with me there. I know how teaching and schools work. Granted this is HIGHLY fictionalized. HIGHLY.

Y'all, this is when Dare2Dream83 called me out and now we're besties.
Everyone tell her thank you for cracking open my Neurospicy brain...

Updated 5/14/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

August - September

Jennifer Kale had cried for exactly two minutes. It had quite possibly been the most she had cried in ten years over something personal. This thing is evolving, a lot, thanks brain! While Agatha and Rio remain the main relationship, the Wandanat of it all is going to be explored more as well. I'll Be Yours For The Weekend

Chapter Summary

The Labor Day Weekend trip and more insight into Nat and Wanda's relationship.
Agatha and Rio grow closer, but still not.

Chapter Notes

Thank you so much to my lovely Beta! She's been helping me flesh things out and reminding me that people cannot read my mind.

Anyway, we're approaching fall in fic-time where we will see more of the celebrity side of things.

Updated 5/21/25!

Labor Day Weekend

It was early. The sun had yet to rise, and the two redheads were only up because they had gone for a run on the beach, their daily runs something they had established when they were eighteen . Wanda held Natâ€™s hand and ran her thumb over her knuckles. She was careful, knowing that her husband and sons were in the house behind them. She wasnâ€™t worried so much about Vision. Rio had changed into her pajamas, having showered after swimming earlier, when she heard her door open and close softly. She let out a breath she didnâ€™t know she was holding as she turned around. She knew it was Agatha and found that she had hoped she would come.

â€œAbsolutely,â€ Rio replied.

Disentangling herself from Agatha's warm arms, which had wrapped around her in deep sleep. Still, it felt like the most normal thing in the world.

When they headed back the next day, she knew she had grown closer to everyone over the weekend, especially Agatha. She had to pull Jen and Alice apart, reminding them that they would see each other in less than twenty-four hours, and reminded the boys about their quizzes the next day.

If her friendship with Agatha was this strong after a month, where would it be by the time they went to New York?

Chapter End Notes

When will one of these women cave? WHEN?!

Soon, I hope.

The Best People In Life Are Free

Chapter Summary

Lilia gives some advice, High School football starts, and Rio and Nicky bond a bit.

Wanda finds herself at a major crossroads and turns to Rio.

Alexa - Play "Good Luck, Babe"

Chapter Notes

Grab some tissues kids and buckle up. I'm not sorry.
Here is the Wanda backstory you've all been waiting for.
Your regularly scheduled Agatha/Rio slow burn returns next chapter.

Updated 5/21/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Early September

Rio never expected anything from her friends except for the ease of being around them. She never expected to be friends with superstars or get invited to movie premieres, Saturday Night Live, parties, or any of the things she was suddenly preparing to attend next month. It was overwhelming, but she felt like she was just doing things with her friends. Some of those things just happened to be red carpet and star-studded events, no big deal.

Before any of that, there was her actual job and the events and responsibilities that came with it. She had administered the first quiz of the semester the week after Labor Day and their amazing beach weekend. While most of her students had hit it out of the park , a select few had not, kicking off after-school tutoring and make-up testing . I'd Be Smart to Walk Away

Chapter Summary

Wanda makes her decision.
It's Homecoming Weekend for SHIELD.
These women.

Chapter Notes

Thank you to the ever-amazing DaretoDream82 for being my sounding board and for reminding me that y'all can't read my mind.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

When Wanda returned home that night, Vision had been waiting for her in their bedroom, reading a book, knowing what was coming. He had anticipated this moment for the past twenty years of their lives and had noticed Wandaâ€™s increasing distance, her frequent absences if the boys werenâ€™t around, and the increased girl time. He gave her the space and time she needed. He would always love her, but he also knew what this had been and he had been grateful for it, but if she hadnâ€™t come forward soon, he was going to. He deserved true happiness as much as she did.

There had been tears and conversation, but absolutely zero hard feelings on his side. They agreed to wait until after the holidays to tell the boys, and Wanda needed to talk to Jen about how they would approach the media. They would work out co-parenting and divorce details later. Neither planned on being nasty about it and they had been more like roommates than anything for a long time. Vision had joked about giving Nat the same shovel talk she had given him once, except she actually could make him disappear without a trace. Wanda had just smiled. She had sent that text to Nat before talking to Vision, knowing Nat wouldnâ€™t respond. Nat would want to have that conversation in person. She also knew what Agatha would do.

Aggie

As she glanced back at Agatha, sleeping peacefully, she tried to crystalize the scene and how happy she felt right now in her heart and mind. I can't lose her , she thought. No matter what I am feeling, I have to turn it off. It can't turn out that way again .







Chapter End Notes

WHEN?! C'mon you two!

So far, I am a chapter ahead of myself and I hope to post every few days. The next chapter should be Thursday!

You Came Along and Changed Everything

Chapter Summary

Feelings are starting to be confronted, and a premiere is attended.

Chapter Notes

This chapter was going to include a few other events, but it would have been 15k or more words. So, I decided to split it. I hope to post Saturday or Sunday. Winter break ended this week and those darn students really cut into writing time. However, snow days today and tomorrow hopefully will provide the time to write...except we're moving this weekend. So...we'll see what happens!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Rio found herself storming into Aliceâ€™s apartment Sunday evening after a day of preparing for mid-terms and quarterly finals. She had also been reflecting on her feelings all day. She was happy being Agathaâ€™s friend, she really was. You Kiss Me In A Way That's Gonna Screw Me Up Forever

Chapter Summary

The premiere, a weekend in New York, and a Halloween party. Our favorite woman have so many opportunities to talk and get closer.

Chapter Notes

Thank you so much to the ever-so-amazing DareToDream82! She has been indispensable in this! She has absolutely helped me sort out my Carolina Reaper level of neurospicy and put it in order.

I apologize for the wait! Have 13.5k words. I refused to split this chapter and I hope what I (we, really) have brought you makes up for it!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Rio was captivated by what was unfolding on the screen before her. There was such amazing chemistry between Agatha and Wanda, even she believed they were passionately in love. The beautiful love scene at the end of the movie was the perfect end to this dramatic psychological thriller. Agatha played an FBI agent, married to Wanda, when they began tracking a major serial killer that consumed Agathaâ€™s character. Wandaâ€™s character struggled with nearly losing her wife so many times and trying to be supportive. The emotional roller coaster ending in this physical and naked scene was almost too much for Rio.

Worst Halloween ever.

I Swear There is Someone, Somewhere, Watching Me

Chapter Summary

There's some drama at school and Rio gets flowers!
A decision is made!

Chapter Notes

"Your last name is even a vegetable, Kale. The worst one too, it's like swallowing a doily."

So yes, in Agatha's phone, Doily is Jen.

This is a very long chapter! I hope the week-long wait is okay when it's a 15k-word chapter. Broken up for easier reading! It's another emotional roller coaster!

Please enjoy!

Chapter End Notes

Thank you so much for all the love you've shown! Kudos, comments, love on socials, etc.

Realistically, unless I start writing smaller chapters again, there are probably only a few chapters left. However, I want to make this a series and do a follow-up with one-shots of different moments of life. What would y'all like to see? There are some things I want to go back and do different POV's of, further into the future on some things, etc.

If that's something anyone would be interested in, of course.

Glitter On The Floor After The Party

Chapter Summary

The order has expired and New Year's Day is full of confrontations and confessions, leading into Golden Globes weekend.

Will Lou meet her end?
Will Agatha come clean? About everything?
Will our favorite idiots confess their feelings?
Will Death's Beloved win all the awards?

Chapter Notes

Trigger Warnings: Light violence, dangerous driving, Lou, heartbreak, mention of pregnancy loss (from personal experience, don't come at me), so much angst, hurt, and anger.

But then, not.
I'm here if anyone needs comfort or to talk. We're at the turning point, really.
Yes, it's another long chapter. You guys know me by now.

Thank you ALL so much for the comments, kudos, WE SURPASSED 10K views and I cried. I came back to writing after an extremely long time of not (as evidenced by the first few chapters) and this journey has been amazing. The love on the socials, just THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!

Thanks to my amazing Beta/Editor/AuDHD thought detangler.

Chapter End Notes

The next chapter or two will be rainbows, butterflies, smut, social media reactions, all the smooth sailing things before we have some final drama.

The main fic will conclude at the end of SHIELD's school year. Then we'll have one-shots, lore, the Lorna story, the Swords story, etc.

I do post sneak peeks during the week, and pics of Raven as everything must meet her standards. Of course.

Y'all are amazing.

Safe As Kittens

Chapter Summary

Everything is calm and right in the world of our beloved coven. Agatha is filming and coming home on weekends, Rio has a new role at SHIELD, and Wanda has her interview with Drew.

A nice, calm month-ish with Oscar nominations, the Grammy's and a realization for Nicky.

Chapter Notes

Triggers: SMUT. Two scenes. SPICE. Bit of self-inflicted blood, the woman was feral, okay?

The Grammy's will be a one-shot later, because this year's Grammy's were a hoot and a half and inserting Agatha and Rio sounds like a blast to me.

Note: I kept Sokovia as a real country, so Wanda's native language is Romanian (sticking to the show). Nat occasionally speaks to her in Romanian and Wanda speaks to Nat in Russian, because they're effing adorable.

Thank you all for the love and for reading the words! More fluffiness and potentially getting back to some drama next chapter...

Oh! I've been obsessing over curating the perfect 'soundtrack' (Spotify playlist) for the past week). I need your recommendations for songs for each chapter. Thanks!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

She Means Everything To Me

Chapter Summary

Another month for our coven!
Valentine's Day, a surprise getaway, Rio's a disaster, communication, The Oscars, a wedding, Spring Break...
You know, just normal coven things.

I am so sorry this is later than usual. The next chapter won't be as eventful, so should be shorter.

Thank you, as always, for all of the comments, kudos, and general love!

Chapter End Notes

Oh damn.

I Have Learned The Lesson Of All That's Foul and Fair

Chapter Summary

A chronological flashback from 1987 to 2024.
How did we get here?
How did Lilia become the Swords of Agatha's tortured past?
How did Lorna fit in?
Just where did everything go so very wrong?

Chapter Notes

In this universe - Agatha is Idina Menzel as well, so, original Maureen, Elphaba, Elsa...

Trigger warnings: All of them.
Death, loss, implied abuse, pregnancy loss, addiction, drug use, implied minor doing illegal things, implied illegal activities, Agatha being Agatha, illness, birth, cold cougars.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

1987 Los Angeles

â€œMom! Why canâ€™t I just go to school normally like other kids? Instead of being tutored and doing everything from a distance? She spent all of her time either under Evanoraâ€™s very controlling thumb or on a set. She had her ways of rebelling and doing what she wanted, but more freedom was something she craved. 1991, Los Angeles

It was Agathaâ€™s eighteenth birthday. Although she had been an adult for longer, she was now legally an adult. That day, she bought a large piece of land that she eventually wanted to build on. For now, she would need to work on getting permits, clearing the land, and extending utilities to it.

Agatha was not like any other eighteen-year-old in the world.

She also was finally going to act on recently developed feelings.

Lilia had always been one of her two mentors. She had come into her life with a mission to free her from Evanoraâ€™s clutches, had been there for her during very dark times, and was one of her closest friends.

Agatha absolutely loved Lilia, just as she loved Lorna. Her best friends happened to be in their thirties, and Agatha happened to be more emotionally mature than her eighteen years on this earth. She wasnâ€™t in love with Lilia, no, but she was attracted to her. She always had been to a degree, but now, it was boiling at the edge, and she needed to act on it.

February 27, 2011, Los Angeles

Oscars Night

After winning an Oscar, Lorna had insisted on going to an after-party. Agatha had wanted to take Lorna home. Lilia had only professional interactions with Agatha. That is to say, only in her professional capacity, although she took every one of them personally. Agatha always treated Lilia with a side of cynicism, but her anger lost its edge the day that Lilia showed up to the house with a bag of sick-day material.

Lilia was at Agathaâ€™s house, Nicky was a freshman, fourteen, and had mono. She came to make him soup like she had done for Agatha when she had caught mono from another actress when she was sixteen.

He was surprised to see real soup, not something out of the can, and ate eagerly.

Agatha sighed. If she was being honest with herself, she missed Lilia, the old Lilia. Her friend and the woman that would take care of her when she was sick, or teach her how to cook. The woman who was caring for her son, that was the Lilia she missed. Not the woman whose memory was tattooed on her hip. No, that was a different woman entirely, wasnâ€™t it?



By early 2024, Agatha and Lilia were on even ground with each other. Nicky was calming down. He had earned the starting quarterback position the previous fall after the previous quarterback was injured. He knew that in order to remain the quarterback for the varsity squad, he had to keep any and all pranks to a harmless minimum. He had also started seeing Morgan Stark, someone he had known since he was four, in a much different light. He didnâ€™t want to lose his chance in any of these respects, so he adjusted his behavior accordingly. Now, Lilia had fewer reasons to call Agatha to deal with her son, and Agatha had fewer reasons to show her sharp tongue. It was a new equilibrium. It wasnâ€™t much. But, it was a start.

March 2024. Los Angeles

Rio Vidal would be the perfect addition to SHIELD. But she was very much a broken woman, physically and emotionally. It didnâ€™t take a psychic to see that. It reminded Lilia of a memory she had buried from long ago. No one should be hurt like that without a chance to heal. Somehow, she had to give Rio just that chance. Alice would be key to that. So would the little family that Agatha had pulled Alice into. Maybe Rio could also fill part of that gaping wound she had opened in Agatha? But that was one stubborn fifty-year-old woman. Maybe Rio would be up to that challenge or distraction, too? Perhaps with enough work, there could be room again for Lilia in their lives. Chapter End Notes

Reaction chapter on Saturday (hopefully)!

This was a hard one to write. I always knew that Lilia had turned herself into the villain in Agatha's story, though she never intended for that to happen, but damn.

Also, LORNA?! God.

Damnit Lorna.
For those of you that don't remember Agatha and Rio meeting before, Chapter 3 and 5 reference it, though it's vague.
Now we know why Agatha made sure the boys went to therapy as kids. Well-adjusted humans with healthy coping mechanisms from the start.

Does she still drink? Sure. Does she sometimes drink too much? Maybe.

Is she in control now?
Absolutely.

Somethin' Happens When Everybody Finds Out

Chapter Summary

Rio finds out.
Wanda finds out.
Agatha and Lilia face each other.

Chapter Notes

I'm sure there are trigger warnings, but honestly, you know what you're walking into now.

For those of you that follow me on socials, you know that this past weekend was rough and I had to put this chapter on hold. Thank you so much for being patient and understanding!

Raven, my cat who is Rio's cat in the story, crossed the Rainbow Bridge on the last day of February. She was at least 18 and I had her for 16 years. We went through A LOT together (I was a wee baby at 23 - I'll be 39 at the end of this month). I'm so sorry this chapter is late!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Present Day

Lilia was Agathaâ€™s ex.

Rio felt as though the walls of the familiar venue were closing in on her. She looked around frantically. She couldnâ€™t fall apart here, not on her sisterâ€™s big day. She would never do this to Alice. She had to get out and get out now. Rio slipped into a back hall, thankful that she had driven. Agatha could call her driver. Rio didnâ€™t care. Seriously, fuck Agatha. No wonder Agatha hadnâ€™t wanted to tell her. Lilia?

Rio needed to talk to Alice, but she couldnâ€™t.

Rio had so many questions for Agatha.

Rio had so many questions for Lilia.

Rio needed an Ouija board.

Rio didnâ€™t know what to do.

She stumbled through the back hallways towards the parking garage, stopping to empty the contents of her stomach. She was reeling from the revelation.

She knew that Agatha and Lilia had known each other for a long time.

Since Agatha had been fourteen.

She thought back to The Harkness Brag Room. Why werenâ€™t there more pictures with Lilia in that room?

Rio recalled seeing the deck of tarot cards in Liliaâ€™s office. Lilia also had a few signed Playbills and posters hanging around her office. She had several of Agathaâ€™s, mainly from 2006 and earlier, which fit with the timeline that formed in Rioâ€™s mind.

â­â­â­

It had been thirty minutes since Agatha had last seen Rio. One minute, Rio was standing and observing everything from the side, taking it all in. But at this moment, Agatha could not locate Rio. Agathaâ€™s eyes scanned the area for any sign of her and saw none. â€œHave you seen Rio? Her phone is going straight to voicemail.â€ Agatha was trying to appear calm, though Wanda saw right through it. Wanda looked over at Nat, who had her phone out.

â€œIâ€™m tracking her now. It's a good thing she never takes that necklace off.â€ Nat looked up at both of them. â€œOh, I can track the necklaces whether the buttons are pushed or not. â€œMaybe the festivities led her to have doubts again?â€ Wanda wondered out loud.

Agatha shook her head. â€œNo, I think weâ€™re okay there. The only thing Iâ€™ve kept back is â€˜the exâ€™sâ€™ identity. But, I havenâ€™t told any of you that.â€

â€œMaybe something just happened to her. How did this end up as my fault? Stop giving me that look. Your face is going to freeze like that.â€

â­â­â­

Rio had gotten back to the apartment and found a spiral notebook. She knew she couldnâ€™t just march over to Liliaâ€™s without being entirely sure that it was Lilia. The Swords that Agatha talked about was cold and distant. A heartless bitch that didnâ€™t love Agatha and had left her at the altar.

The Lilia Calderu she knew was manipulative and cryptic, sure, but she had also let Rio off on late notice to go gallivanting around the world with Agatha. She had given her insight into Agatha and noticed when she was anxious.

March 2024 - San Francisco

AWG [Alice] visits RV [Rio] in the hospital and tells RV to come to LA to SHIELD.

Rio stopped writing and thought back on different interactions and what she knew. Lilia being Swords would explain why she had such a soft spot towards Nicky, but so would Lilia and Agatha being close.

It was some weird middle-ground.

That also explained why no one else knew. Leave it to Agatha to not want her past to cloud other people's judgment of someone.

So WHY had Lilia pushed Rio towards Agatha? She needed to talk to Lilia. Lilia had emotionally scarred Agatha and ruined her.

This same woman had helped Rio find a home and allowed her to coach again, knowing it would bring her joy.

Had she done that out of loyalty to Alice, because of her last name?

What in the holy hell was happening? It was eight on Saturday night, and the reception had been wrapping up, so hopefully, Lilia would be home by now.

Rio grabbed her keys and headed to Liliaâ€™s.

â­â­â­

Agatha had soup, crackers, Gatorade, and everything she needed in case Rio had actually fallen sick. If she had had time, she would make soup herself. It was something Lilia had taught her how to do that week Nicky had mono.

The week that an unspoken truce had been made between them.

Agatha even had a giant stock pot now that would one day also be ancient and possibly come with a side of tetanus.

If youâ€™re lucky, Lilia had said, shaking her head at Agathaâ€™s sarcasm.

Agatha had even picked up treats for Raven and flowers for Rio. Agatha commended herself for getting better at this girlfriend thing. She was hoping she would still have a girlfriend in a few hours. Agatha was still in her suit from the reception as she knocked on Rioâ€™s door and waited.

Nothing. Just as she feared.

â€œMaybe sheâ€™s asleep.â€ Agatha thought aloud. She used her key and let herself inside. â€œBaby? Itâ€™s just me. I brought you soup! From the place you like down on the corner!â€

â€œLilia. It was Lilia?â€

Wandaâ€™s face drained of color, a feat for the already fair-skinned redhead. Then, it contorted to hurt as the realization of the past nearly thirty years crept in. â€œAgatha, God! Iâ€™m so over the manipulations and the betrayal! Nearly THIRTY years of it. How can I trust you, that this is all of it, that youâ€™re not holding back anything else important?â€ Wanda looked away from Agatha, her bottom lip quivering.

â€œI was never supposed to be the one being betrayed, Agatha.â€



Agatha leaned forward, her head dropping. She knew that the hardest challenge still lay ahead, and she dreaded having to add salt to Wandaâ€™s emotional wounds tonight. She hated the feeling of causing pain to the person she swore to protect.

Chapter End Notes

In My Defense, I Have None

Chapter Summary

Wanda and Rio head up to the mountains for some much-needed bonding time.

Meanwhile, all of the conversations are had back in LA, and then up in the mountains. A lot happens in a short amount of time.

Chapter Notes

Thank you so much for your patience and for being so amazing! This is an extremely long chapter.
I apologize for nothing. Hydrate. It's broken up for convenience, like always.

Trigger warnings: We know me. A roller coaster of emotions with a side of darkness. Touches on addiction, and extremely illegal activities, we get into childhood backgrounds a bit more and they aren't pretty.

Also, welcome to the musical episode of Buffy - I went on some side quests apparently.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was Wandaâ€™s turn to drive as they talked about the revelations of the past eighteen hours and how they were feeling about everything.

â€œI feel so stupid, believing I was exempt from Agathaâ€™s betrayal,â€ Wanda began. â€œI mean, small lies and omissions, sure. Not big things like this, though. Wanda was waving wildly with one hand and barely keeping her other on the steering wheel as they headed north.

â€œWell, welcome to this side of your sister. Sorry, itâ€™s your first time.â€ Rio deadpanned.

She felt terrible that Wanda was having to experience it, yet in the short time she had known Agatha, and the even shorter time she had been with her, this seemed to be a reoccurring event, and she hated it. Yes, Rio had kept things from Agatha, but she had made a concerted effort not to do that any longer after the Lou fiasco.

Yes, Rio had slept with a sociopathic jewel thief, thought for a millisecond she was still in love with her, and briefly considered going back before she realized the manipulation techniquesâ€™ effects. However, she had made it very clear to both Agatha and Lou that she no longer wanted anything to do with Lou Falco. Then there was Agatha. Agatha had slept with Rioâ€™s boss for a whole decade. â­â­â­

Nicky had Agathaâ€™s key to Rioâ€™s apartment and was opening the door to get Raven as Alice and Jen were leaving theirs. They had another week until they moved onto the compound and were in full-on packing mode. Alice was confused upon seeing Nicky, as he usually didnâ€™t come over.

Nicky bent down to pick up Raven, who had come into the hall to investigate and rubbed her in between the ears.

â€œRio does stupid things too, Nicky,â€ Alice said in defense of Agatha.

Nicky put Ravenâ€™s head to his chest and tried to cover both of her ears. â€œDonâ€™t talk about her mother like that in front of her,â€ he gasped.

Jen tried to hide her smile. For a kid who wanted nothing to do with acting, he had his motherâ€™s natural talent.

â€œIâ€™m going to call Rio and find out whatâ€™s going on. You take good care of the cat-god there.â€

â­â­â­

Alice knew something was horribly wrong. Rio hadnâ€™t stayed late at the reception yesterday, she hadnâ€™t even given Alice a goodbye hug or an â€˜I love youâ€™â€”something they always did. That old familiar pang of jealousy slowly crept up on Alice, and she had to bat it away mentally. She looked up at Jen, worried. â€œMaybe thereâ€™s no service where theyâ€™re at right now?â€ Alice looked to Jen for reassurance.

â€œOf course, love, Iâ€™m sure everything is fine.â€

â€œYou have to call her back. You know sheâ€™s going to worry, and she doesnâ€™t even know whatâ€™s going on. Put it on the Bluetooth.â€ The redhead instructed.

Much earlier that morning

Nat couldnâ€™t sleep and, knowing Agatha had gone straight to Liliaâ€™s, decided to join both of them. Nat had done what she could to keep Lilia in her life, even if at the edges. Lilia and Lorna had done so much for her all of those years ago.

When Wanda met Vision and subsequently fell in love, Nat stayed strong for Wanda but died on the inside. She went straight to the two people who had more experience with relationships. March 2, 2011, Los Angeles

Three Days After Lornaâ€™s Death

Agatha had been packing to leave for San Francisco the next day. She had stopped and sat on the edge of her bed to catch her breath. â­â­â­

Agatha had returned to the compound around nine Sunday morning. She knew she had to wait before rushing up to the Mammoth Lakes area where Liliaâ€™s cabin was, roughly three hours south of the Tahoe cabin. She would shower, pack preemptively, and bide her time. Nat had stayed back at Liliaâ€™s for a bit to let the vodka wear off before driving, and they all agreed it was best to wait until Wanda left before she went back to the house. Vision had texted Nat to ask what was up since he was keeping the twins, and she told him everything. Agatha had always been amazed at how quickly they had formed a bond all those years ago, and it really didnâ€™t surprise her that Lilia and Lorna had a hand in that.

They had played puppetmaster more than she knew.

Agatha showered and thought of Rio. Lilia had told her about the conversation, so she knew that it was the omissions and the lies that bothered Rio the most. Not to mention the who of it all. Agatha had slept with the majority of the women at SHIELD, which didnâ€™t bother Rio, but Rio had developed a working friendship with Lilia, more than that, Rio trusted Lilia. Lilia had given Rio advice, pushed them together, and had a hand in bringing her out here.

Then there was just Lilia, as part of Agatha. Lilia wasnâ€™t just another notch in the mountain of invisible lipstick cases either. Lilia was the only other relationship that Agatha had ever been in, as contorted as it was. Rio also hadnâ€™t known just how big of a part Lorna and Lilia had played in Agathaâ€™s past, it wasnâ€™t something they talked about.

â€œMaybe itâ€™s time to write a book about the first part of my life,â€ she said to the empty bathroom as she turned the water off and stepped out of the shower to dry off and put on comfortable clothes. She planned on taking a nap and texting Rio later. She wanted to give her some space right now and let her spend time with Wanda.

The contrast of where she was yesterday evening and now stood out to her. Yesterday, they were celebrating Alice and Jen, and she was picturing her future with Rio. Now, she was preparing to fight for that future. She would be fifty-two soon, and she was done letting the trauma of the past hold her back. She and Rio needed to communicate and, for the love of all things holy and unholy, be honest with each other. Discuss what they wanted, talk through where they stood, and discuss a way forward.

Agatha had to stop, separate her personas and truths, merging them into one person, for Rio at least. She would always put on a different mask for public consumption, but for her loved ones, she had to remove this mask she had been wearing. She had to let down the walls she had constructed.

She also had to fix things with Wanda, she and Lilia were mending their relationship, and she had to speak with Alice before she spoke with Rio.

Jen was going to be working overtime this week when Agatha and Wanda werenâ€™t where they were supposed to be.

Agatha groaned as she rolled over to try to take a nap.



Something warm was on Agathaâ€™s chest. Something warm and loud. She cracked her eyes open and looked down to see two green eyes staring at her.

â€œRaven? How did you get here?â€ She asked, fully expecting a spoken response. Instead, the cat just looked at her, as if expecting the human to read her mind.

Then, memories of the last twenty-four hours rushed back. She remembered that Rio had headed north with Wanda and suspected that Alice had been lying to her for over a decade. This would make sense as to why Raven would be here since Rio fully trusted Nicky to take care of the person that Rio might love most in this world. Her cat.

â€œNicky has you for a few days, doesnâ€™t he? Well, welcome back, Your Highness,â€ Agatha said as she gently lifted Raven off of her chest and placed her on a pillow. Raven rewarded her with a low growl. â€œWell, I love you too.â€ Agatha got up and went to find Nicky to see what he knew.

It was mid-afternoon, and she found him downstairs sitting on one of the couches, scrolling on his phone. He raised his head when he heard her come down the stairs.

â€œThere you are, Mom. Come sit down, we need to talk.â€ His voice was serious, and so was his facial expression.

She was slightly taken aback as she had a seat and looked at her son.

â€œGeeze Dad, what did I do? I promise it was Johnny who caused me to stay out past curfew!â€ She played innocent, trying to make him laugh.

It didnâ€™t work.

â€œCut the theatrics, Mom, this is serious. Tommy and Billy are at Uncle Visionâ€™s house. Aunt Nat didnâ€™t get home until after Aunt Wanda left. Rio and Aunt Wanda disappeared to the mountains, and they didnâ€™t go to the cabin in Tahoe. Alice didnâ€™t know anything and was worried when she called Rio. You left late last night and didnâ€™t get home until this morning. Iâ€™m taking care of Raven instead of Alice.â€ He threw a hand into the air. â€œWhat is going on?â€

Agatha looked at her son, realization hitting her like a blow from an MMA fighter. Nicky was like her in so many ways, and she and Wanda, along with Vision and Nat, had worked so hard to raise these boys in a happy and healthy home with many adults who loved them. They had vowed to let them be kids and give them every opportunity they could. They made sure to take care of their social-emotional and psychological needs as well as their physical and educational needs.

Yet here Nicky was, still wise beyond his years. It wasnâ€™t a bad thing, but Agatha wondered just how much of his youth she may have stolen from him. How much he had been forced to grow up.

Like she had been.

How many times had he parented her? Like he was doing now. She had always treated him like an actual human being. She had never talked down to him or treated him like a second or third-class citizen like some people did with children.

Here he was, demanding answers for what should be adult problems, yet he cared because it did involve him. This was his family, and she didnâ€™t want him to worry.

Agatha felt as though she was waking up from a nearly twenty-year dark night and realizing there had been quite a few casualties along the way.

â€œShe said sisters shouldnâ€™t separate themselves and lead double lives, that someone hurts the other.â€ Alice popped her head up and looked across the table. â€œMother fucker!â€

â€œYes, but we can come back to that.â€

â€œNo, she was warning me about becoming her! The way she hurt my mom and Agatha!â€ Alice was tired of having life-changing revelations, but she was also understanding a lot more.

â€œDamnit Rio. Thatâ€™s what I was doing. I was closer to Lilia than I let on, closer to Agatha and everyone, and had Jen and confided in her. I was living this whole other life and justifying it with the law when I should have roped you in.â€

â€œSo, you admit that you were wrong, youâ€™re going to be honest with me, weâ€™ll read the journal, and weâ€™re okay?â€ Rio summed everything up.

Nat and Alice had taken their bags up to their rooms. Agatha stepped into the room and passed echoes of herself through the ages. Rio pouted.

â­â­â­

Tuesday morning had begun with Jen calling Agatha to get all of them to the nearest TV in the next fifteen minutes. She woke Rio and pounded on two bedroom doors. Ten minutes later, they were waiting for the news as Jen had instructed. Coffee was brewing in the background and they would eat after they watched whatever it was they were supposed to watch.

Breaking news music played, and the graphic flashed across the screen as the announcer came on the screen.

â€œLou Falco, famed supermodel and ex-wife of former NFL quarterback Shane Falco was found deceased at the infamous Island psychiatric prison complex early this morningâ€¦â€

She didnâ€™t know if someone had muted the TV, but Rio didnâ€™t hear another word, and her body numbed at the words. She wasnâ€™t sure how to feel. She didnâ€™t want to be happy that someone was dead, but she was relieved to know she was finally safe, and that slightly concerned her.

It was how she felt when her parents died. However, back then, she was very young. That she didnâ€™t find it concerning.

The touch of Wandaâ€™s hand brought Rio out of her spiraling thoughts.

â€œIt doesnâ€™t make you an awful person to feel safe,â€ Wanda said, leaning over the couch and rubbing Rioâ€™s arms. â€œIt makes you human, and thatâ€™s okay.â€

â€œI just... three kids lost their mother,â€ Rio said, voice barely above a whisper.

â€œRi, those babies havenâ€™t had a mother in years. You even told me that when the oldest left for college, she went no contact and only talked to you.â€

Rio nodded as Agatha sat beside her and wrapped her arms around her, kissing her cheek.

â€œI love you. Youâ€™re one of the strongest women I know, and I am here for whatever you need.â€

Rio knew she was surrounded by love, and yet again, it was comforting.

It was definitely time to get back to therapy, though.

Agatha was projecting all the warmth she could onto Rio. Inside, she had chilled to the core. Jen had known, what else had been set into motion? Agatha thought of the Russian assassin. She wasnâ€™t sure how or when Nat had done it, possibly pulling some strings and making some calls. She never questioned Natâ€™s methods in all of these years, she was just glad everyone was safe. But, the ruthlessness and reach sometimes surprised her, and Agatha worked to keep it all to herself.

Nat continued to read the words that were scrolling across the screen. She had sent a few details here and there, but just like always, she hadnâ€™t done the dirty work. Not enough to get into any serious legal trouble.

She hadnâ€™t gotten her hands bloody in that way since Agatha had made her a part of their ragtag family twenty-seven years ago. Fights, framing, blackmail, and threats to make people disappear. Yet, she was never the one who followed through on that, and the women always dismissed her denials as necessary theater and plausible deniability. But Nat knew that was untrue.

Someone else just always got there first.

Chapter End Notes

Sharon!

I thought things would be more explosive, but I have no control anymore and this is where it went. I am literally the author and I control nothing.

The next chapter might be the last, might not. I don't know anymore.
What I do know is I have ideas for a sequel and so many one-shots, a series of Lorna's letters, the Nat and Wanda story, just so many things. Make sure to subscribe to the series! I've given over 200k words and I have many more to give!

Get Your Shit Together, So I Can Love You

Chapter Summary

Things start to settle down with the coven and Wanda talks to Lilia.

Chapter Notes

It's a shorter chapter.
Warnings:
Underage drinking alluded to, other illegal activities. Like we do.
Smut!

Again, thank you so much for all the love! Make sure to subscribe to the series!
There really is only one more chapter for this part!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Hours after the news broke, Rio sat on the couch, scrolling through social media. The internet was buzzing with news that Agatha and Wanda were not at their respective sets, videos of drunken, angry karaoke, pictures of someone that looked like Rio coming out of the small clinic on the mountain, and just pictures of WandRio in general.

They were sticking with the nickname to everyone's annoyance.

Alice had been texting back and forth with Jen all Tuesday morning, especially after the news of Louâ€™s demise had broken. Jen was trying to make sure no connections were made. She had already intercepted a picture of Rio from the previous school, coaching one of Louâ€™s daughters, hoping nothing else leaked. Combined with speculation from the internet, Jen was trying to put out fires everywhere and was drafting a statement to put out just in case.

The news had said that the supermodel succumbed to natural causes, and an autopsy would be performed. The woman had only been fifty-five, and Rio wondered what natural causes people would believe. She tried to focus on her mindless scrolling and read various things about her and her friends.

â€œShe already did, though Lilia had no problem with you taking time in the first place.â€ Agatha walked into the room and took a seat next to Rio. Agatha handed her the next dose of pain meds, and Rio took them gratefully, curling into Agatha after swallowing them with water.

â€œBecause I work there and have ears, Agatha. Itâ€™s not all of them, obviously, but itâ€™s led by one or two of the more jealous types. So I Dare to Risk This Heart of Mine

Chapter Summary

The end of the school year and a few events.

Chapter Notes

We are here at the end.
Thank you so much everyone! I never thought my little story would get this much love!!
Also, there's uh, the smuttiest scene I've done so far. More smut to come in the next stories.

Keep an eye out on the socials for when I update the first few chapters!
Also, for announcements for the next installment and other stories!

Thank you so much to DaretoDream82 who stuck with me through most of this thing and helped edit, beta read, translate my thoughts, pull thoughts from my head, worked so many late nights with me, even when she was overseas.
I'd also like to thank our wives for putting up with us.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Part of Rio had been worried that Alice was playing her own April Foolâ€™s Day prank. However, walking into the teacherâ€™s lounge and seeing the looks on a few faces of women in their black Fencing Club shirts reassured Rio that her ride and/or die had indeed been telling her the truth. Alice had gone with her and made sure to immortalize the looks of absolute horror and disgust and sent them to the rest of the coven.

It was a good day with zero harmful pranks, and the students just thought their teachers were referencing an after-school Happy Hour. These kids were not phased by many things and at this crucial time of the year, they had bigger things to worry about than what manner of questionable things their teachers were doing.

The shirt became one of Agathaâ€™s favorites, judging by the way she greeted Rio at the door and ravaged her on the couch, unable to make it to the bedroom.

The school year always moved faster towards the end of the year with testing, ceremonies, performances, and all of the major projects due. With Agatha and Wanda so busy during the week, Rio felt like minutes flew by, but days slowed down. Football was in spring training, track was in full swing, and she found herself looking forward to the weekends more than usual or doing test prep with upperclassmen for college entrance exams. There were also AP tests and Dual Credit tests for those trying to get college credits.

They had Coachella, the Beach Music Festival, the Prom, and the SHIELD end-of-the-year showcase to look forward to.

While not all students at SHIELD were into fine arts, several still wanted to show off their talents and they prepared all year for this week. The last week of school was filled with showcase scrimmages, one-act plays, art displays, and recitals, with everyone showing off their skills. Their lives were packed for most of April and May, leading up to Memorial Day weekend at the beach house to kick off the summer.

The powers that be for SHIELD had deemed the next two Fridays and Mondays â€˜virtual instructionâ€™ days since a large portion of students would be either attending one of the two weekends of Coachella or going with their parents to the area but not to the festival itself, much like they did for days after award ceremonies. â€œI know, kid. I know.â€

Agatha leaned back on the railing, something about the tone around the familiar phrase Lilia loved to use nagging at the back of her mind. She had to ask Lilia, who also leaned on the railing beside her. Agatha looked at her, considering everything she knew about her old mentor.

â€œIt was you, wasnâ€™t it? Not Nat. Every single time something needed to be handled?â€

Lilia gave a wry smile. â€œNever send a Russian to do an Italian job.â€

Agatha shook her head as she left Lilia at the railing, smiling the whole time, knowing that Lilia had still always been there throughout the years.

She joined everyone by the pool and seated herself behind Rio, letting the gorgeous woman lean back into her chest as she would a chair. Wrapping her arms around Rio, Agatha gave her a chaste kiss and looked at her family around her. She knew that this was exactly where Lorna had wanted them to be, and that warmed her heart all the more.

â­â­â­

Until Next Time.

Chapter End Notes

This part is over.

What's to come in the future?
Will Alice ever open that envelope?
What is Jen's background story?
Will Rio be connected to SF?
What's in store for our coven?
What did Lorna write in all of those letters?
What did she say to the redheads?
Will Lilia and Sharon make a move?

Next: Editing the first few chapters, and then...converting this to a book and looking into publishing options.
Working on the next installment, some one-shots, and preparing for Agatha All Along week.

This universe will continue.

An Update

Chapter Summary

Updated!

Hello lovely readers!
While posting, I kept saying I was going to update the first few chapters.
Well, I did that. Today (May 6th, 2025), I updated chapters one through five. They are amazing and added quite a few words...
I have updates for other chapters too, especially six, but it's not ready to be posted yet. I added the scene of Alice asking Jen out, and it's cute y'all.

But Ellen (my pen name), what did you change/add/edit?
Well, I know the first several chapters were without a beta/editor (DaretoDream82). Because of that, they were rushed and I was still very rusty in my return to writing. We have more inner dialogue, more character development, just more . The first part feels more like the rest of the fic. I also just working on continuity issues as a whole.
ALSO, for those that did not follow the series, it IS a series now! I'm working on the next chapters for those right now. Good Luck Babe, the prequel of sorts, and I am Your Summer, the short mini-fic before the full-blown sequel.
I was hoping to post for Agatha All Along week, but I may just keep on with what I'm doing, we'll see what happens.
I will post updates as I update more chapters!
PLEASE ENJOY THE NEWLY IMPROVED 1-5!

Afterword

Please drop by the Archive and comment to let the creator know if you enjoyed their work!
